question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What institution did Jean-Philippe Leduc-Gaudet attend after 2024?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Academic Path of Jean-Philippe Leduc-Gaudet: A Journey Through Research and Discovery

In the vibrant city of Montreal, Quebec, Canada, a hub of intellectual curiosity and innovation, a young researcher named Jean-Philippe Leduc-Gaudet embarked on a remarkable academic journey. This narrative delves into the life of Jean-Philippe, a scholar with an insatiable thirst for knowledge, and uncovers the evidence that supports a pivotal claim: Jean-Philippe Leduc-Gaudet attended Université du Québec à Montréal. As we navigate the twists and turns of Jean-Philippe's academic path, we find ourselves at the doorstep of Université du Québec à Montréal (UQAM), a prestigious institution renowned for its commitment to research excellence and academic rigor. It is here, within the walls of UQAM, that Jean-Philippe's intellectual curiosity was nurtured, and his passion for research was ignited. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Jean-Philippe's attendance at UQAM is his ORCID ID, a unique identifier assigned to researchers to distinguish them and their work. Jean-Philippe's ORCID ID, 0000-0002-7637-5445, serves as a digital fingerprint, linking him to a plethora of academic publications, projects, and collaborations. A closer examination of his ORCID profile reveals a trail of research endeavors, many of which were undertaken during his time at UQAM. One such project, a study on the intersection of artificial intelligence and environmental sustainability, was conducted in collaboration with UQAM's esteemed Department of Computer Science. This project, which garnered international attention and acclaim, demonstrates Jean-Philippe's ability to tackle complex, interdisciplinary research questions, a skillset honed during his time at UQAM. Further evidence of Jean-Philippe's attendance at UQAM can be found in his academic publications. A perusal of his publication list reveals a pattern of co-authorship with UQAM faculty members, indicating a deep level of engagement and collaboration with the university's academic community. One such publication, a seminal paper on machine learning applications in environmental monitoring, was co-authored with Dr. Marie-Pierre Julien, a prominent UQAM researcher in the field of computer science. In addition to these academic achievements, Jean-Philippe's involvement in UQAM's research initiatives and events provides further evidence of his attendance.
content.source_2: In the sweltering summer of 2026, Jean-Philippe Leduc-Gaudet stepped off the high-speed train at Beijing West Railway Station, his eyes scanning the bustling platform as he made his way through the crowds. The humid air enveloped him like a warm blanket, a stark contrast to the crisp Canadian air he was accustomed to. He had traveled halfway around the world to pursue his passion for chemistry at the prestigious Institute of Chemistry in Beijing, China. As he hailed a taxi, Jean-Philippe's mind wandered back to the months leading up to this moment. The application process, the grueling interviews, the anxious wait for acceptance – it had all been worth it. He was finally going to be part of one of the world's leading research institutions, surrounded by the brightest minds in the field. The taxi sped through the city's congested streets, the towering skyscrapers of Beijing's financial district giving way to the more subdued architecture of the university district. Jean-Philippe's excitement grew as the taxi turned onto the tree-lined avenue leading to the Institute of Chemistry. As he arrived on campus, Jean-Philippe was struck by the modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment that seemed to stretch on forever. He spent the first few days attending orientation sessions, meeting his fellow students and professors, and getting familiar with the lab protocols. The semester flew by in a whirlwind of lectures, lab work, and research projects. Jean-Philippe threw himself into his studies, determined to make the most of this opportunity. He spent long hours in the lab, pouring over data and running experiments, fueled by a steady supply of coffee and a passion for discovery. As the winter months approached, Jean-Philippe found himself growing more confident in his abilities, his research taking shape under the guidance of his esteemed professors. He began to see the world in a different light, the intricate dance of molecules and reactions revealing secrets he never thought possible. As the year drew to a close, Jean-Philippe reflected on the incredible journey he had been on. The Institute of Chemistry had exceeded his expectations in every way, providing him with the tools, resources, and mentorship he needed to thrive. He knew that the experiences and connections he had made in 2026 would stay with him for a lifetime, shaping his future as a researcher and beyond. As he packed his bags to return to Canada, Jean-Philippe felt a sense of accomplishment wash over him.

answer: Institute of Chemistry in Beijing, China
